info.title: WebApplicationFirewallManagement
info.description: APIs to manage web application firewall rules.

get.description: List all network manager connections created by this subscription.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: An optional query parameter which specifies the maximum number of records to be returned by the server.

parameters.name: $skipToken
parameters.description: SkipToken is only used if a previous operation returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a nextLink element, the value of the nextLink element will include a skipToken parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

get.description: Get a specified connection created by this subscription.

parameters.name: networkManagerConnectionName
parameters.description: Name for the network manager connection.

put.description: Create a network manager connection on this subscription.

parameters.name: networkManagerConnectionName
parameters.description: Name for the network manager connection.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Network manager connection to be created/updated.

delete.description: Delete specified connection created by this subscription.

parameters.name: networkManagerConnectionName
parameters.description: Name for the network manager connection.

configurationDescription.description: A description of the security admin configuration.

ruleCollectionDescription.description: A description of the rule collection.

kind.description: Whether the rule is custom or default.

skipToken.description: When present, the value can be passed to a subsequent query call (together with the same query and scopes used in the current request) to retrieve the next page of data.

ActiveConnectivityConfigurationsListResu.description: Result of the request to list active connectivity configurations. It contains a list of active connectivity configurations and a skiptoken to get the next set of results.

value.description: Gets a page of active connectivity configurations.

skipToken.description: When present, the value can be passed to a subsequent query call (together with the same query and scopes used in the current request) to retrieve the next page of data.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the default security admin rule
Indicates the properties of the security admin rule

ActiveSecurityAdminRulesListResult.description: Result of the request to list active security admin rules. It contains a list of active security admin rules and a skiptoken to get the next set of results.

value.description: Gets a page of active security admin rules.

skipToken.description: When present, the value can be passed to a subsequent query call (together with the same query and scopes used in the current request) to retrieve the next page of data.

description.description: A description for this rule. Restricted to 140 chars.

protocol.description: Network protocol this rule applies to.

sources.description: The CIDR or source IP ranges.

destinations.description: The destination address prefixes. CIDR or destination IP ranges.

access.description: Indicates the access allowed for this particular rule

priority.description: The priority of the rule. The value can be between 1 and 4096. The priority number must be unique for each rule in the collection. The lower the priority number, the higher the priority of the rule.

direction.description: Indicates if the traffic matched against the rule in inbound or outbound.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the resource.

properties.description: Indicates the properties of the security admin rule
Indicates the properties for the network manager admin rule collection.
